page.title: 18TRAFFIC SURVEY 1/7/85
page.content: On July 1st we went out to take another traffic survey to see whether the traffic had increased because of the Royal Show. There were lots of light goods vehicles on Gibbet Hill, but there were more(32) on the bypass. The most common vehicles on the bypass were the heavy goods vehicles.We found that the traffic on the bypass had increased as it had at Gibbet Hill. Most of the cars had Royal Show stickers on their windscreens.One coach load of people going into Coventry had come from the show. The number of motor-bikes had increased-4 on Gibbet Hill,6 on the bypass. There were no bicycles on the bypass,4 at Gibbet Hill(it was a hot sunny day). On the bypass we counted 571 cars compared with 244 on Gibbet Hill.
